item.title: EclipseCon France 2018: Register Early!
item.description: Prices go up after April 30, so register now.

item.title: Survey of 1800+ developers now released on new Jakarta EE website
item.description: Survey of 1,800+ Java developers reveals "cloud native" top requirement in platform's evolution.

item.title: IoT Developer Survey 2018 | Results are in!
item.description: Results from the IoT Developer Survey are in! Read about the key findings about IoT cloud platforms, databases, security, and more.

item.title: Eclipse Oxygen 3A has been released!
item.description: Download the Oxygen 3A packages today.

item.title: Winners of Open IoT Challenge 4.0 Demonstrate How Open Source Accelerates Innovation
item.description: Eclipse IoT is pleased to announce the winners of the fourth annual Open IoT Challenge!

item.title: EclipseCon France 2018 Program Announced
item.description: See the list of accepted sessions, and register now for the lowest price. We'll see you June 13 - 14 in Toulouse.

item.title: Voting for the Jakarta EE logo is now open!
item.description: Voting will be conducted using a ranked poll. To vote, simply rank the final shortlist of logos in order of preference.

item.title: Three days left to complete the Jakarta EE Survey!
item.description: One week left to share your insights on Java EE and help shape the future of Jakarta EE.

item.title: Eclipse Newsletter | Code in Different Languages
item.description: Read what's new in the Eclipse JDT Language Server and Eclipse PDT (PHP), then learn about Eclipse Xtext and Eclipse Mita (IoT).

item.title: Complete the Jakarta EE Developer Survey
item.description: Share your insights on Java EE and help shape the future of Jakarta EE.

item.title: Eclipse IoT Day Santa Clara | Speakers Announced
item.description: We're pleased to announce the speakers for the Eclipse IoT Day Santa Clara, co-located with IoT World 2018 on May 14.

item.title: Last call for EclipseCon France submissions
item.description: Deadline to propose a talk is Monday, March 19. Get your talk in now for your chance to be part of a great program!

item.title: Eclipse Foundation supports EU funded Brain-IoT Project
item.description: Eclipse Foundation Europe Selected to Provide Open Source Community Building Expertise for EU funded IoT Research Project

item.title: Eclipse Foundation Announces 2018 Board Member Election Results
item.description: Today we are please to announce the results of the Eclipse Foundation Sustaining Member and Committer Member elections.

item.title: From Java EE to Jakarta EE
item.description: We are happy to announce that the new name for the technology formerly known as Java EE is... Jakarta EE!

item.title: Eclipse Newsletter | Boot & Build Eclipse Projects
item.description: Featuring articles about Spring Tools, Gradle plugin (Buildship), Dirigible cloud platform, and EMF Parsley.

item.title: Countdown: 2 weeks | Complete IoT Developer Survey
item.description: Take 10 minutes to complete the fourth annual IoT Developer survey!

item.title: EclipseCon France 2018 | Call for Papers
item.description: Call for paper submissions are now open until March 19. We'll see you June 13 - 14 in Toulouse!

item.title: EE.next working group | Community review process
item.description: Announcing the EE.next working group to support the EE4J projects. Join the review process of the charter.

item.title: Last Week to Submit for FOSS4G NA 2018!
item.description: Submissions close Feb 8, so propose your talk now for FOSS4G NA 2018, May 14-16 in St. Louis

item.title: Eclipse Newsletter | Coming in 2018
item.description: What's coming to the Eclipse Community in 2018? Read the newsletter to find out!

item.title: Launching IoT Developer Survey 2018
item.description: We are pleased to launch the fourth annual IoT Developer Survey! Complete the survey today.

item.title: Eclipse IoT Day Santa Clara 2018 | Call for Papers
item.description: We're happy to announce the Eclipse IoT Day Santa Clara, taking place May 14, in co-location with IoT World 2018.

item.title: Eclipse Newsletter | Capella: open source MBSE solution
item.description: Learn everything about Capella, an open source workbench that allows engineers to design complex systems.

item.title: Open Source Community Accelerates Big Data Analytics for Geospatial Solutions
item.description: LocationTech announces new project releases that provide core technology for geospatial big data analytic solutions.

item.title: Announcing Open IoT Challenge 4.0 Scholars
item.description: Congratulations to the Top 12 teams who submitted the best proposals for the fourth Open IoT Challenge!

item.title: Eclipse Newsletter | Location Matters
item.description: This newsletter is everything geospacial (LocationTech) + a featured article about creating video games.

item.title: Open IoT Challenge 4.0 | Extended Deadline Nov 20
item.description: One last week to submit your open IoT solution idea. You can then work on it until March 15. Submit now!

item.title: EclipseCon + Ludwigsburg = Great Partners
item.description: We are pleased to announce a strategic partnership between the Eclipse Foundation Europe and the City of Ludwigsburg that keeps EclipseCon Europe at the Forum am Schlosspark through 2019.

item.title: New Industry 4.0 Open Testbed Addresses Performance Monitoring and Management in Manufacturing
item.description: Bosch Software Innovations, CONTACT Software, Eurotech, fortiss GmbH, and InfluxData collaborate to demonstrate Product Performance Management.

item.title: Eclipse Science Advances Open Source Technology for Scientific Research
item.description: The Eclipse Science Working Group, a working group of the Eclipse Foundation, today announced the new releases of five open source projects used by the scientific research community.

item.title: Eclipse Newsletter | Utility Belt: Projects and Tools
item.description: Learn about JUnit 5, e4 on JavaFX, scripting with EASE, embedded tools and Eclipse CDT, Ferret search tool, and software ethics.

item.title: On Naming Eclipse Enterprise for Java (EE4J)
item.description: What is EE4J? Will it become the brand that replaces Java EE? Read the blog post to find out.

item.title: EclipseCon Europe: Last Chance for the Early Price
item.description: October 5 is the last day to save €100 on ECE registration.

item.title: Annual Donation Campaign: End User Support for the Eclipse Foundation
item.description: To encourage end-user support, we are launching the October Donation Campaign. The goal is to have over 1000 individuals donate to the Eclipse Foundation and help support the overall community.

item.title: Eclipse IoT Announces Fourth Edition of the Open IoT Challenge
item.description: IoT enthusiast? This Challenge is for you! Submit your IoT solution proposal by November 13.

item.title: Eclipse IDE Now Supports Java 9
item.description: Java 9 has been released into the world and support to make your Eclipse IDE ready to build, run, and debug Java 9 applications is available from the Eclipse Marketplace.

item.title: Special Notice for Eclipse IDE Users on macOS 10.13 in non-English mode
item.description: When Eclipse is launched on macOS 10.13 and user's primary language is not set to English, all the menu items in the main menubar are disabled. However, Context menus are not disabled

item.title: Get the Early Price for EclipseCon Europe
item.description: Register now and save €100! Prices go up after October 5.

item.title: Eclipse Newsletter | Eclipse MicroProfile
item.description: In the September issue of the Eclipse Newsletter, discover everything you need to know about Eclipse MicroProfile.

item.title: Java EE Moves to the Eclipse Foundation
item.description: Oracle announced today that they, along with IBM and Red Hat, will be moving Java EE to the Eclipse Foundation.

item.title: First Release of Eclipse Papyrus for Real Time: Modeling Tool for UML-RT
item.description: The Papyrus Industry Consortium, an Eclipse Foundation Working Group, is pleased to announce the release of Eclipse Papyrus for Real Time v1.0 (Papyrus-RT) a fully open source modeling tool intended for teams working on the design and implementation of embedded reactive systems.

item.title: Eclipse Public License Version 2.0 Approved By OSI and Eclipse Foundation Board of Directors
item.description: The Eclipse Foundation is pleased to announce a new version 2 of the Eclipse Public License (EPL v2) has been approved by the Eclipse Foundation Board of Directors and the Open Source Initiative (OSI).

item.title: Eclipse Newsletter | Exciting New Eclipse Projects
item.description: The latest newsletter is all about new and exciting projects!

item.title: EclipseCon Europe: Schedule and Keynotes
item.description: The keynotes are announced, and the schedule is on line for ECE 2017. Register now!

item.title: Launching Eclipse IoT Newsletter
item.description: We're lauching a quarterly Eclipse IoT Newsletter. Subscribe to receive the first issue this September.

item.title: Eclipse IoT Day @ ThingMonk
item.description: Register for the Eclipse IoT Day co-located with ThingMonk on September 11 in London, UK.

item.title: Potential adware plugin on Eclipse Marketplace - Eclipse Class Decompiler
item.description: A listing on Eclipse Marketplace, called Eclipse Class Decompiler, contains binary code that could be used for adware and could potentially download files to Eclipse workspaces.

item.title: Eclipse Newsletter | Summer Issue
item.description: The latest Eclipse Newsletter is now available. Read it and learn how to try out Java 9 Support for Eclipse Oxygen!

item.title: EclipseCon Europe 2017 | Submissions Close in One Week
item.description: There’s still time until July 17th, to get your submission in for this year’s EclipseCon Europe in Ludwigsburg Germany.

item.title: Eclipse Oxygen Now Available
item.description: We're proud to announce the arrival of Eclipse Oxygen, the 12th annual simultaneous release from the Eclipse Community. DOWNLOAD NOW!

item.title: Eclipse Newsletter | Eclipse Oxygen
item.description: Find out more about the latest Eclipse Simultaneous Release in the June issue of the Eclipse Newsletter!

item.title: Early Submission Deadline for EclipseCon Europe 2017
item.description: Submit your talks by June 30 to be selected for featuring in the early promotion. October 24-26 in Ludwigsburg Germany.

item.title: Capella Industry Consortium (IC) Announced at PolarSys
item.description: Capella IC to host the Capella Ecosystem stakeholders in a vendor neutral way, organized by an open governance model.

item.title: RC3 Available for Eclipse Oxygen | Download Now
item.description: Download and test release candidate 3 for Eclipse Oxygen!

item.title: Last Chance to Register for EclipseCon France 2017
item.description: Sign up for learning at EclipseCon France, June 21-22. XText, Capella, Science, Docker, LSP and much more!

item.title: Eclipse Newsletter - Language Server Protocol 101
item.description: Everything you need to know about the Language Server Procotol (aka LSP) is in this month's newsletter!

item.title: It’s time to organise Eclipse Oxygen DemoCamps
item.description: What is an Eclipse DemoCamp and why should I organise one?

item.title: Case Study: Deploying Eclipse IoT on Germany's DB Railway System
item.description: We worked with Deutsche Bahn (DB) to find out how they use Eclipse IoT technology on their railway system!

item.title: EclipseCon Europe 2017 | Call for Papers Open
item.description: Submissions are now open for EclipseCon Europe 2017, October 24 - 26, in Ludwigsburg, Germany.

item.title: Program Ready for EclipseCon France 2017
item.description: See the program, and register by May 12 for the best price.

item.title: New Eclipse IoT Open Testbeds
item.description: Announcing the creation of the Eclipse IoT Open Testbeds, an initiative to drive adoption of IoT open source and open standards.
